subject: Re: How to test error handling?
msgSnippet: ... Yup.  That s how I do it, too. That tests that an exception is thrown when it should be.  I think the question was how to test that exceptions are handled
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Erik Mattsson" <erik.mattsson@i...> wrote:
> Hi
>
> When Im doing exception testing it may look like this:
>
> public void testBadData()
> {
> try
> {
> object.generateBadData();
> fail( "BadDataException should have been thrown, but wasnt.");
> } catch ( BadDataException bde )
> {
> }
> }
>
>
> This is a very simple test to make sure that an exception is thrown,
> it isnt pretty, but it works

Yup. That's how I do it, too.

That tests that an exception is thrown when it should be. I think the
question was how to test that exceptions are handled properly when
they are thrown.

Dave
